episodeTitle: Off to the Blue Sea! A Heartfelt Finale!
episodeTitleJapanese: いざ青海へ！！想いが織りなす最終楽章
episodeTitleRomanized: Iza Seikai e!! Omoi ga Orinasu Saishū Gakushō
description: The Straw Hat Pirates depart from Skypiea with help from Pagaya and Conis, descending to the Blue Sea via Cloud End. As the Golden Bell rings in farewell, an Octopus Balloon cushions their fall. However, Luffy's antics cause the balloon to deflate, leading to a crash landing directly into a Marine base.

events.title: Gan Fall Accepts Leadership of Skypiea
events.description: The Shandia Chief asks Gan Fall to once again become the God of Skypiea, uniting the Sky People and Shandians under his leadership. Gan Fall accepts this responsibility, marking the peaceful resolution of the 400-year conflict.
events.significance: Represents the end of the centuries-long war between the Shandians and Sky People, establishing peace in Skypiea and fulfilling one of the arc's central conflicts.

quotes.text: Will you accept the role of God once more?
quotes.speaker: Shandia Chief
quotes.context: Asking Gan Fall to lead the unified Sky People

events.title: Aisa's Hair Cut Symbolizes Peace
events.description: Raki cuts Aisa's hair, which the young Shandia girl had kept short for battle. This symbolic act represents Skypiea's transition from war to peace, as Aisa no longer needs to prepare for conflict.
events.significance: A touching symbol of the new peaceful era in Skypiea, showing how even the youngest generation is affected by and relieved from the burden of war.

quotes.text: I was the only one who got to say goodbye to them. Luffy told me to keep it a secret.
quotes.speaker: Aisa
quotes.context: Explaining her secret farewell to the Straw Hats

events.title: Aisa's Admiration for Luffy
events.description: Aisa reveals to Raki that Luffy told her their goodbye was a secret and expresses admiration for his strength, wishing she could stretch her arms like him.
events.significance: Shows the impact Luffy had on even the youngest inhabitants of Skypiea, demonstrating his ability to inspire people of all ages.

quotes.text: I wish I could stretch my arms like him!
quotes.speaker: Aisa
quotes.context: Expressing admiration for Luffy's rubber abilities

events.title: Straw Hats Depart Skypiea
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates set sail from Skypiea aboard the Going Merry, heading toward Cloud End with the assistance of Pagaya and Conis. The crew prepares to descend back to the Blue Sea after their adventures in the Sky Island.
events.significance: Marks the conclusion of the Skypiea Arc and the Sky Island Saga, one of the most significant arcs in One Piece. The crew leaves behind friends and a restored peace.

events.title: The Golden Bell Rings in Farewell
events.description: As the Straw Hats descend from Skypiea, the Sky People ring the Golden Bell as a gesture of gratitude and to signal that the Straw Hats are always welcome to return. The sound of the bell echoes across the sky as a heartfelt farewell.
events.significance: A powerful emotional moment that demonstrates the deep gratitude of the Skypieans and Shandians. The bell, which was the focus of the arc's central mystery, now serves as a symbol of friendship and welcome.

events.title: Octopus Balloon Summoned
events.description: Conis summons an Octopus Balloon, a special creature from the White Sea, to help cushion the Going Merry's descent from Cloud End to the Blue Sea. The octopus grabs onto the ship to slow their freefall.
events.significance: Introduces the Octopus Balloon creatures and demonstrates the unique solutions available in the Sky Islands for traveling between the White Sea and Blue Sea.

events.title: Wyper Affirms Shandora's Spirit
events.description: Wyper reflects on the legacy of the Shandians and their ancestors, affirming that the spirit of Shandora will endure now that peace has been achieved with the Sky People.
events.significance: Provides closure for the Shandian storyline, showing that while the war is over, they will never forget their heritage and the sacrifices of their ancestors.

events.title: Cricket and Saruyama Alliance Hear the Bell
events.description: Back on Jaya in the Blue Sea, Montblanc Cricket, Masira, and Shoujou hear the Golden Bell ringing from the sky. This confirms for Cricket that the City of Gold truly exists in the heavens, validating his ancestor Montblanc Noland's claims.
events.significance: Provides emotional payoff for Cricket's lifelong search and vindicates his ancestor Noland, who was executed for supposedly lying about the City of Gold. This moment brings closure to the Jaya portion of the saga.

events.title: Cricket Decides to Continue His Dream
events.description: After hearing the Golden Bell and confirming the City of Gold exists in the sky, Cricket tells Masira and Shoujou that he's calling off the search for the underwater city. However, when they ask if he's leaving the alliance, he responds by asking which dream they'll pursue next, indicating he plans to continue adventuring with them.
events.significance: Shows Cricket's growth and his decision to move forward with new dreams rather than being bound by the past. It also reinforces the theme of dreams that pervades One Piece.

quotes.text: Which dream are we going to pursue next?
quotes.speaker: Montblanc Cricket
quotes.context: Telling his crew he's not leaving despite ending the search for the City of Gold

events.title: Luffy Jumps on Octopus Balloon
events.description: During the descent, Luffy begins jumping on the Octopus Balloon's head like a trampoline, treating it as a toy. Sanji notices the octopus is shrinking as air escapes from it due to Luffy's actions.
events.significance: A comedic moment that showcases Luffy's carefree nature and sets up the crew's predicament of crash-landing. It's typical of Luffy to create problems through his playful behavior.

events.title: Octopus Balloon Deflates
events.description: The Octopus Balloon loses too much air from Luffy's jumping and begins to deflate completely. The Going Merry starts to freefall toward the Blue Sea at dangerous speed.
events.significance: Creates tension and danger for the crew's return journey, showing that even their departure from Skypiea isn't without peril.

events.title: Usopp Uses Breath Dials to Slow Descent
events.description: As the Going Merry freefalls, Usopp attempts to use the Breath Dials acquired from Skypiea to slow their descent, though this only provides limited help.
events.significance: Shows the practical application of Skypiean technology that the crew has acquired, though it's not enough to prevent their crash landing.

events.title: Crash Landing in the Blue Sea
events.description: The Going Merry crashes down from the sky and lands in the Blue Sea. Despite the intense fall, the ship survives relatively intact, and the crew is relieved to be back in familiar waters.
events.significance: Marks the crew's successful return from the Sky Island to the Blue Sea, completing their journey through the Sky Island Saga. However, their relief is short-lived.

events.title: Landing at Marine Base G-8
events.description: The Straw Hats realize with horror that they haven't landed in open ocean, but directly in the middle of a Marine military base - specifically, the fortified Marine Base G-8. Sirens begin blaring and spotlights train on the Going Merry as Marines become aware of their presence.
events.significance: Sets up the G-8 Arc (filler) and creates immediate danger for the crew. From one adventure directly into another crisis, the crew must now escape from a heavily fortified Marine installation.

quotes.text: Will you accept the role of God once more?
quotes.speaker: Shandia Chief
quotes.context: Asking Gan Fall to lead the unified Sky People

quotes.text: I was the only one who got to say goodbye to them. Luffy told me to keep it a secret.
quotes.speaker: Aisa
quotes.context: Explaining her secret farewell to the Straw Hats

quotes.text: Which dream are we going to pursue next?
quotes.speaker: Montblanc Cricket
quotes.context: Telling his crew he's not leaving despite ending the search for the City of Gold

themes.description: The episode focuses heavily on the peaceful resolution between the Shandians and Sky People, with Gan Fall's acceptance of leadership symbolizing the end of 400 years of conflict.
themes.symbolism: Aisa's haircut represents the transition from war to peace, showing how the youngest generation is freed from the burden of conflict.

themes.description: Cricket's decision to pursue new dreams after confirming his ancestor's story reinforces the series' central theme that dreams should propel us forward, not keep us stuck in the past.
themes.symbolism: The Golden Bell's ringing serves dual purposes - validating the past (Noland's truth) while signaling a future of friendship and welcome.

themes.description: The Skypieans and Shandians express profound gratitude to the Straw Hats through the ringing of the Golden Bell, showing how the crew's actions created lasting bonds of friendship.
themes.symbolism: The Golden Bell itself transforms from a symbol of lost history to a symbol of gratitude and welcome.

themes.description: Just as one adventure ends, another begins. The crew's landing at Marine Base G-8 shows that a pirate's life is never without danger and excitement.
themes.symbolism: The transition from sky to sea, from one arc's end to another's beginning, represents the endless nature of adventure.

characterSpotlights.development: Gan Fall accepts the role of God once more, this time leading a unified Skypiea. His acceptance represents wisdom, forgiveness, and the willingness to serve his people despite past conflicts.
Cricket achieves vindication for his ancestor when he hears the Golden Bell, proving Noland's story was true. Rather than dwelling on this validation, he chooses to pursue new dreams with his crew.
keyActions: Hears the Golden Bell from the sky
Decides to pursue new dreams with the Saruyama Alliance
quotes: Which dream are we going to pursue next?

characterSpotlights.development: Aisa's haircut and her secret goodbye to Luffy represent the new generation freed from war, while also showing Luffy's impact on even the youngest characters.
keyActions: Gets her hair cut as symbol of peace
quotes: I was the only one who got to say goodbye to them. Luffy told me to keep it a secret.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's playful nature causes the octopus balloon to deflate, leading to their crash landing. His carefree attitude creates both comedy and consequence, typical of his character.
keyActions: Jumps on Octopus Balloon causing it to deflate
Leads crew into Marine Base G-8 by accident

mangaDifferences.difference: The episode expands on the departure sequence and adds more emotional moments with the Skypieans that were shorter or less detailed in the manga.
The octopus balloon deflating and the descent taking longer with more comedic moments is extended from the manga's briefer version.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode of both the Skypiea Arc and the Sky Island Saga, concluding 43 episodes of Sky Island adventures (episodes 153-195).
This episode marks the last appearance of the ending theme 'Tsuki to Taiyo' by Shela, which had been used since episode 169.

Episode 195 corresponds to Chapter 302 of the manga, titled 'Finale'. At this point, the anime was only 22 chapters behind the manga, making it the closest the anime had ever been to the manga's current publication.
This was the last edited Funimation dub episode to air on television in the United States.
The landing at Marine Base G-8 sets up an 11-episode filler arc (episodes 196-206), which is considered one of the best filler arcs in One Piece due to its humor and character moments.
The TV rating for this episode in Japan was 10.0%, ranking #7 for its timeslot, showing strong viewership for the Skypiea finale.
